en: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
hmr: Chuongchun, hi mi pathum hai hin Job an dawnna chu an tâwp tah a, ama mithmua chun a fel tlat si leiin.

en: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
hmr: Ram hnama mi Buz mi Barakel naupa Elihu lung chu a sen tah a; a lunginsenna chu Job chungah a nih a hung sat chu, ama le ama chu Pathien nêka thiem ân changtir tlat leiin.

en: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
hmr: A ruolhai pathum chunga khawm a lunginsenna chu a hung sa bawk a, dawnna ding hmu suok si loin, Job chu thiemnaw an inchangtir si leiin.

en: Now Elihu had waited to speak unto Job, because they were elder than he.
hmr: Tuhin Elihu chun Job kuoma thuhril ding chu a nghâk a, ama nêka anni chu an upa lem leiin.

en: And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, his wrath was kindled.
hmr: Chun, Elihu chun chuong mi pathum hai baua inthawk chun dawnna hrim a um naw ti a hmu chun a lunginsenna chu a hung zuol tah a.

en: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; Wherefore I held back, and durst not show you mine opinion.
hmr: Chun, Elihu Buz mi Barakel naupa chun a dawn a, a hril tah a: “Kei naupang ka na, nangni chu upatak in na; Chuleiin, kân sûm a, ka ngaidân chu in kuomah kân entir ngam naw cheu a nih.

en: I said, Days should speak, And multitude of years should teach wisdom.
hmr: ‘Nihai chun hung hril a ta, Kumhai tamna chun varna inchûktir naw nîm,’ ka lo ta.

en: But there is a spirit in man, And the breath of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mihriema chun thlarau a um a, Iengkimthawthei chun a thuokin anni chu hrietthiemna a pêk a ni lem a.

en: It is not the great that are wise, Nor the aged that understand justice.
hmr: Mi ropuihai chu an var chuong kher nawh a, Mi upahai chun thudik chu an hrietthiem vawng kher bîk nawh.

en: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will show mine opinion.
hmr: Chuleiin, ‘Kei mi ngai unla, Kei khawma ka ngaidân inhriettir ka tih’, ka ti a nih.

en: Behold, I waited for your words, I listened for your reasonings, Whilst ye searched out what to say.
hmr: “Ngai ta u, in thuhai chu ka nghâk zing a, In thuhril sanhai ka lo ngai zing a, Ieng am hril ding tia in zawng sûng po khan.

en: Yea, I attended unto you, And, behold, there was none that convinced Job, Or that answered his words, among you.
hmr: Anih, in kuomah ka um zing a. Chun, ngai ta u, nangni lai tukhawm Job thuhne hrim hrim in um dêr nawh a. Annawleh, nangni lai a thuhai dawn thei hrim in um dêr naw a nih.

en: Beware lest ye say, We have found wisdom; God may vanquish him, not man:
hmr: ‘Varna kan hmu suok tah, Mihriem ni loin, Pathien chun a namhnuoi a nih’, ti hlau rawi in tih.

en: For he hath not directed his words against me; Neither will I answer him with your speeches.
hmr: A thuhai chu keima kal zâwngin ân kâwltir nawh a, In thuhrilhai angin kei khawmin ama chu dawn bawk naw ning.

en: They are amazed, they answer no more: They have not a word to say.
hmr: Anni chun mak an ti tah a, an dawn ta hrim hrim nawh a, Thu bau khat khawm hril ding hrim an nei ta nawh a.

en: And shall I wait, because they speak not, Because they stand still, and answer no more?
hmr: Thu an hril ta naw leiin, An ngîr ṭawk ṭawk a, an dawn ta hrim hrim naw leiin, ka nghâk ding maw?

en: I also will answer my part, I also will show mine opinion.
hmr: Kei khawma ka chana chun dawn vêng ka ta, Kei khawma ka ngaidân chu inentir vêng ka tih.

en: For I am full of words; The spirit within me constraineth me.
hmr: Thuhaiin ka sip sih a; Ka sûnga thlarau hin a mi tirlui a nih.

en: Behold, my breast is as wine which hath no vent; Like new wine-skins it is ready to burst.
hmr: Ngai ta u, ka sûng chu uoin hu suokna nei lo ang chu a nih; Peng tharhai puokkawi ṭêp ding ang chu.

en: I will speak, that I may be refreshed; I will open my lips and answer.
hmr: Ka sâwl a dam huoina dingin thu hril ka ta, Ka bau kain dawn ka tih.

en: Let me not, I pray you, respect any man’s person; Neither will I give flattering titles unto any man.
hmr: Ka hni cheu hi, mi tukhawm mi nina chu mîn zâtir naw unla, Mi tukhawm kuomah hming ṭha tehlêm chu pe bawk naw ning.

en: For I know not to give flattering titles; Else would my Maker soon take me away.
hmr: Inpâk tehlêm chu ka thiem si nawh a, Chuong naw chun, kei mi Siemtu hin mi la hmang vak rawi a tih.
